title: Investors Dare to Dip Back Into Bonds
sub_head: Some investors say bond prices have fallen to levels that are too good to pass up, offering an alternative to stocks
body:
Bonds are back, say investors who are daring to buy into the battered market.
Stability emerged in debt markets this week, with the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield retreating from a peak over 3% following a five-month rout that worsened as stocks plummeted. While most of the buyers anticipate further turmoil if the U.S. economy slides into recession, bond prices have fallen to levels they say are too good to pass up, offering a credible alternative to stocks.
